The subcommittee met, pursuant to notice, at 1:09 p.m., in room 2172, Rayburn House Office Building, Hon. Ileana Ros- Lehtinen presiding. Ms. Ros-Lehtinen. The subcommittee will come to order. Pursuant to notice, we meet today to mark up four bipartisan measures. As members were notified previously, to ensure that we can move expeditiously to our hearing, we will consider today's items en bloc. And so without objection, the following items provided to your offices earlier this week will be considered en bloc and are considered as read: House Resolution 201, Expressing support for the Government of Argentina for its investigation into the terrorist bombings of the Embassy of Israel in Buenos Aires on March 17, 1992; Smith amendment, which was worked out between majority and minority staff last night and this morning; House Resolution 259, Expressing concern and condemnation over the political, economic, social, and humanitarian crisis in Venezuela; the Duncan amendment in the nature of a substitute to H.R. 259; the Castro amendment--that is the good Castro--19 to the ANS; the Torres amendment 29 to the ANS; House Resolution 336, Reaffirming a strong commitment to the United States-Mexico partnership; H.R. 1918, the Nicaraguan Investment Conditionality Act of 2017; and Ros- Lehtinen amendment 23 to H.R. 1918. </option>
Hearing.Statement: <opening>[The information referred to follows:]</opening> <paragraph paraId="1" speaker="">House of Representatives,</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="2" speaker="">Ms. Ros-Lehtinen. Without objection, all members may have 5 days to submit statements and materials for the record.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="3" speaker="">In the interest of time, I plan to submit my remarks and Mr. Duncan's remarks for the Congressional Record. I encourage other members to submit their remarks for the Congressional Record as well.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="4" speaker="">And I want to applaud the leadership and help of all of our congressional subcommittee in bringing attention to all of these terrible situations throughout the world.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="5" speaker=""> And with that, I would like to turn to Mr. Duncan's ranking member, Mr. Sires. </paragraph> <speaker>Mr. Sires</speaker> <paragraph paraId="6" speaker="Mr. Sires">I have no comments. I agree.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="7" speaker="Mr. Sires">Ms. Ros-Lehtinen. Thank you very much.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="8" speaker="Mr. Sires">As you know, we have a series of votes on the floor, five votes. And so I will turn now to the page that does it legally.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="9" speaker="Mr. Sires">Do any other members seek recognition to speak on today's business?</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="10" speaker="Mr. Sires">Seeing no members, the Chair now moves that the subcommittee favorably report the items considered en bloc to the full committee as amended.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="11" speaker="Mr. Sires">All those in favor, say aye.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="12" speaker="Mr. Sires">All those opposed, no.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="13" speaker="Mr. Sires">In the opinion of the Chair, the ayes have it. The motion is approved. House resolution 201, 259, 336, and H.R. 1918 are reported favorably to the full committee as amended.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="14" speaker="Mr. Sires">Without objection, staff is directed to make any technical or conforming changes.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="15" speaker="Mr. Sires">As you know, all of the members and the staff have been working for 2 weeks now on this markup, so don't think that they haven't been read and studied.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="16" speaker="Mr. Sires">The chairman wants to thank all of the members and staff for their assistance and cooperation on today's markup. And the subcommittee stands adjourned.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="17" speaker="Mr. Sires">[Whereupon, at 1:12 p.m., the subcommittee was adjourned.]</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="18" speaker="Mr. Sires">----------</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="19" speaker="Mr. Sires">Material Submitted for the Record</paragraph>
